text:
On some test files, running a GUI-mode test works fine but trying to run a 
console-mode test causes a crash--Null error in NonGuiTree.addSubTree
(ListedHashTree, NonGuiTreeNode); it appears that addSubTree is passed a null 
value for "current" (second param) from addComponent, and this causes an 
exception in addSubTree.  AddSubTree will catch the exception the program 
continues running, but the test doesn't seem to execute.  In GUI mode, if I add 
a listener for results, I can see stuff happening.
creator: kbroderick@xtriahc.com

text:
Created attachment 3266
Somewhat real test case
creator: kbroderick@xtriahc.com
kbroderick@xtriahc.com
text:
Created attachment 3267
Extremely simple test case that causes same problem

It appears the problem is either an old one, having to do with the 1.7Beta3
release, or the problem is that you are using old-format files in the newer
JMeter releases.  To upgrade a file from old format to the newer format, simply
resave it from JMeter's GUI.  The format will be updated.
creator: mstover1@apache.org

text:
Marking all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8's release date as VERIFIED.
Yes, it's pretty poor QA procedure, but there's bugs here lingering since JMeter
1.6, and we need to clean up a little.
creator: jsalvata@atg.com
jsalvata@atg.com
text: Bulk-closing all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8 release date.
